item.title: Outside No13 Kemplay Road, 18th September
item.description:
I am writing to raise a complaint regarding ongoing obstruction caused by building works at 13 Kemplay Road. Since the commencement of these works, builders have been placing cones and barriers after they finish works and overnight on both sides of the street, blocking access without displaying any valid trades permit. This has been a persistent issue, creating unnecessary disruption for residents and road users. To my knowledge, no permission has been granted, and the situation has continued unchecked since work began. Please could you investigate this matter urgently and take appropriate action to ensure that the road is kept clear unless the builders have the correct authorisation. If valid bay suspensions have been given by camden for this property then these should be clearly marked for resident to see. Thank you for your attention to this issue. Original complaint regarding this matter was sent to Camden Parking Operations Team on September 10 including multiple photos. They have responded to my complaint referring me to you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kemplay Road, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gas pipe cut, 18th September
item.description:
At 3am this morning, man shouting threatening to kill a person in 11 Orient Way. He, or someone else brought a ladder to the property and cut the gas pipe. There is CCTV pointing directly at the property. Needs to be viewed. Not safe. Fire Brigade attended
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Orient Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 22, 18th September
item.description:
The tree outside #22 has not been lopped / pruned at the top in over 10 years and needs proper maintenance. It is now very tall (higher than the houses), and it is leaning significantly to one side. There are also very low hanging branches which are a problem for lorries. Passing lorries have hit the leaning tree and caused damage to the tree trunk and hit the low lying branches. In the recent high winds earlier this week it looked precarious. In addition, there are drains nearby which are likely being compromised by the tree roots. The tree trimmers from the Council that come around have only cut off a token low lying branch. The tree outside #24 has also not been lopped for over 10 years. Can you please advise if and when future works are planned to address this issue? Thank you for your attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shirlock Road, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet
